intro: Balthasaria schliebenii var. schliebenii, commonly known as the Schlieben's balthasaria, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along riverbanks or in humid forests. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
